lines.text: Forgive me, Doctor, but I am calling you a liar!
Mr. McGee!
[takes a deep breath, smiles]
Mr. McGee, don't make me angry.
[chuckles]
You wouldn't like me when I'm angry.
[first title card]
Within each of us, ofttimes, there dwells a mighty and raging fury.
You know, my mother always used to tell me, "Getting angry doesn't help."
I always liked your mother.
She always liked YOU.
You know 'em well?
Yes, I did, Mr. McGee. Was it really necessary to print that?
"Incredible 'Hulk' Kills 2"]
Well, it's the truth. It's what happened.
And it sells newspapers.
Look, Doctor... I saw what that creature did to a steel chamber. And I heard your friends talking; they were scared to death it was coming back.
You actually SAW the thing?

You're damn right I did. I gave a description to all the law-enforcement agencies; they got a - a warrant for MURDER out on it! Now a THING that looks like that Hulk is not gonna stay hidden for long. When they grab it, that is gonna be one of the great stories of the Twentieth Century.
[walks off in disgust]

[to himself, as Ben walks off]
One of the best.
[walks off himself, limping on a crutch]
I love you Elaina. I think you loved me too. Although you never said it.
[turns to Elaina in agitation]
When the metamorphosis happens, I don't have any control over it; I don't even know what it DOES! I could have killed you.
[gives a start of horror]
Maybe that's why I was wounded. Maybe I tried to kill somebody last night - maybe I DID kill somebody.
Listen to me! David Banner is NOT a killer.
We're not talking about David Banner.
Yes, we ARE!
Do you think we will ever find where that strength comes from?
I don't know. But we'll certainly share a lot of donuts together, and I'll probably get fat.
Mr McGee, your newspaper is only interested in reporting murder, rape, horoscopes, UFO's and Farrah Fawcett. I don't happen to fit into any of those categories - and I wish NOT to be interviewed.
[walks off]
All right, Dr. Banner. But I don't give up easily.
One tiny portion of a living cell. Well, I tell ya, as many times as I've seen it, it still facinates me that it would take over a half a million of those to cover the head of a pin.
Well enjoy the view, it's all we've got.
David?

[wincing in pain]
Yeah?
When did you say you were shot?
I don't know, sometime early this morning.
Well I'll tell you, this wound looks like it's been healing for a few days.
I know.
I gotta get something to drink, I'm dehydrating.
David, try to remember...
I, ah, I remember... feeling incredibly strong... it was me... and it wasn't me.

[recreating the conditions of his first Hulk-out]
Hey wait a minute, last night was an electrical storm!
Oh brother, you really do have a Ben Franklin complex, don't you?

[holding a footprint of the Hulk]
There's a girl and her father over at the lake who say that they saw the thing that made this.
Did they? Well what was it, Bigfoot?
Sounds more like the Jolly Green Giant. Only I wouldn't call him too jolly. Big hulk, about seven feet tall. Greenish tinge to the skin. Pretty mean looking.
All right, but I wanna make sure that that never happens again. I wanna be Dr. Banner, not Dr. Jekyll.

[seeing the carnage to the lab made by the Hulk]
Well now, no little bacteria did that.

[to David]
Hey, do us both a favor, don't get mad, huh?
Oh God, my poor David...

[touches the Hulk's face]
Who will take care of you now?
But eh, Doctor, any time you, eh, feel an interview coming on, you... you get in touch, will you?
[slams notebook in rage]
David, believe me, if I knew the answer, I'd tell you.
We'll keep on searching until we find out how to make you normal again.
I suggest that we get our research materials together, and move to safer quarters.
Where?
I don't know... we'll think of a place.
...keep on searching...
We'll think of a place.
I always liked your mother.
She always liked you.
